value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. These provide great examples of what your R Script should look like to interact with data and you can compare how your visual looks to the example.   R Script Showcase - http://community.powerbi.com/t5/R-Script-Showcase/bd-p/RVisuals

value.title: Append vs Merge in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: Combining two queries in Power Query or in Power BI is one of the most basic and also essential tasks that you would need to do in most of data preparation scenarios. There are two types of combining queries; Merge, and Append. Database developers easily understand the difference, but the majority of

value.title: Count of Unique Values DistinctCount in Power BI Through Power Query Group By Transformation
value.excerpt: You can have a distinct count calculation in multiple places in Power BI, through DAX code, using the Visual's aggregation on a field, or even in Power Query. value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt

value.title: Using ALLEXCEPT vs ALL VALUES
value.excerpt: ALLEXCEPT is a handy DAX function to retrieve all the columns of a table except for some. When used as a CALCULATE modifier, its behavior is less intuitive and might result in inaccurate measures. In this video, we elaborate on the most common mistake when using ALLEXCEPT in CALCULATE. Article and download:

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Scope report design requirements
value.excerpt: Gathering appropriate inputs to scope your report design requirements involves identifying your audience, determining the suitable report types, and defining their interface and experience requirements. This module provides you with a strong foundation on which to learn how to plan your report design requirements.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Append and Merge Tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly merge and append tables using the query editior in Power BI. Build models with multiple data sources. Contact me on LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland
